comment: This professor was not easily accessible.  She graded on her feelings and not the criteria she established.  If your paper did not include certain buzz words she was looking for, it seemed like an irritation to her and she basically ignored the paper and gave negative comments.  Her interpretation is off and her feedback was always negative.

I really, really disliked Dr. Myers the first half of the semester. She wasn't the best at responding to emails and at times, I felt the things we discussed in her class, or rather statements she made, were highly inappropriate. By the second half of the semester my "Hate her" opinion changed to "Eh, she's okay". Very mediocre at best.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Its a lot of information, so wouldn't advise taking it as a summer class. Professor responds fast to emails and if you need to set up one on one meetings she is willing to do so. Quizzes mostly consist of explanations so can be difficult at times kinda a tough grader.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a nice person, just not the best professor to take online.

Extremely tough grader and makes you redo almost every assignment. In the beginning it was foggy but I ended up liking her more. It doesn't seem to make alot of sense what she is doing at first, but you end up learning alot.

Dont take her. Just dont. Its possible to do well in the class, but it is such a hassle and harder work than necessary. She seems like she could be a great person, but when it comes to class and what she expects out of assignments, you never know what you will get with her. If you have to, the class is doable, but just dont do that to yourself
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT take this teacher. She pretends to care about her students, but does not. She is not focused on students learning or how much effort students put in, but only that they follow the unclear rubric. She is unclear with what she actually wants students to do, and wants students to do additional work not stated in the rubric.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I would not recommend taking Math 3316 with Professor Myers during summer if you truly are not good at math. You get moved to a new seat every class. She makes you discuss with your group a lot and if no one at your table knows it then you are out of luck. She is a tough grader and does not give extra credit. You have 5 quizzes and 2 tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Meyer's makes it very clear what her expectations are and if you follow them the class will be easy. She gives such good feedback on quizzes and makes sure you understand what you did wrong. I would 100% take her again. She does a lot of "chat with your group" which is helpful when you aren't understanding in her words.
Wonderful professor! She gives great feedback and is VERY clear on what is expected on every assignment!

Loved taking her. She's very approachable if you have any questions about anything. The content was very clear and she knows what she's talking about. If you don't feel like she's making sense- ask her to clarify. She's more than happy to help, but she also isn't going to let you do nothing in her class and make an A. Sweet person in general.

Dr. Myers was the best math teacher I had out of all the education math classes at KSU. She teaches the math in a way that you will understand! She makes sure everyone has an understanding of the material before taking quizzes and tests. You can tell she cares about her students! I would take her again if I had the chance!!
Out of all the math education teachers at KSU, Dr. Myers is the best one! She makes the class entertaining  and her way of teaching the material is easy to follow! Take her as many times as you can!

The syllabus did not line up with her teachings, she also only read power point slides and in my opinion did not actually teach material. She was very confusing on her methods and her study guides were very irrelevant to the test we took. The class was to cover geometry yet I still have little knowledge of the subject or how to effectively teach it

I would not, under any circumstances, take this professor again. She was highly unprofessional. I felt that she allowed her biases to influence her grading.  Her rubric did not match up with her grading and. Her calendar and cut off times was not aligned with the syllabus.  She does not communicate or respond to urgent questions on a regular basis.
